title: If magic was real, would technology beat it? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would surely depend on both the magic and the tech in question. Harry Potter versus the Modern World? Harry Potter gets its robed ass handed to it. But a random D+D wizard of about 15th level and above could solo the modern world easily. The Culture, on the other hand, would likely not have too many problems wiht that wizard (Um. Probably. D+D wizards are broken). What can your magic do? What can your tech do? Without those questions, it really isn’t answerable. The same applies if we are hypothetically talking about the ‘real’ world. (I’m actually running a long-term RP game based on very much this principle - a small group of people get magical powers in 2018 on New Years Day, and become ageless alongside it. A lot of the point of the game was how these near immortal characters change and are changed by humanity. Kind of Midnight’s Children, but Shounen and not as well told. : P )

Magic is real, and no, technology can’t beat it. As Jesus said, “If you have faith as much as a grain of mustard seed, you will be able to say to that mountain, ‘move’, and it will move; and nothing will be impossible for you.”
